rules: Rule1: If the commission held a public hearing on the regulation, then the commission issued a recommendation to the agency.

Rule2: Under the condition that the commission issued a recommendation to the agency, either the agency granted an exemption to the industry, or if the industry withdrew the appeal in the case, then it is not the case that the industry filed a legal challenge against the regulation.
Rule3: Either the agency shows leniency toward the industry or the agency acknowledges the industry's cooperation.
Rule4: Provided that the agency acknowledges the industry's cooperation, the agency does not impose a penalty on the industry.

Rule5: If the industry has first-time status regarding the violation, then under the condition that the agency shows leniency toward the industry, the agency does not impose a penalty on the industry.
Rule6: Either the industry has first-time status regarding the violation or the industry made a good faith effort toward compliance.

Rule7: Either the board conducted an independent review of the investigation, or if it is not the case that the industry making a good faith effort toward compliance implies that whenever the agency shows leniency toward the industry, the agency does not impose a penalty on the industry, then the agency provided technical assistance to the industry.
Rule8: If the agency enforced the emission limits regulation, then the agency passed the pollution control policy.
Rule9: Whenever the agency confirms the industry's violation, the industry did not commit a violation of the emission standards.
Rule10: If the agency found conflicting evidence regarding the industry, then it is not the case that the industry clearly violated the standards.
Rule11: Under the condition that the agency launched an investigation into the industry, the agency completed the investigation of the industry.

Rule12: Provided that the agency collected monitoring data as evidence, whenever the agency launches an investigation into the industry, the industry does not commit a violation of the emission standards.
Rule13: Either the industry filed a legal challenge against the regulation or the governor issued an emergency directive to the industry.
Rule14: Whenever the agency and the industry reach a settlement, the industry did not file a legal challenge against the regulation.
Rule15: Either the agency and the industry reached a settlement or the industry withdrew the appeal in the case.

Rule16: Provided that it is not the case that the industry making a good faith effort toward compliance implies that under the condition that the agency shows leniency toward the industry, the agency does not impose a penalty on the industry, then the agency did not provide technical assistance to the industry.

Rule17: Whenever it is not the case that the agency completing the investigation of the industry implies that the agency confirmed the industry's violation, the agency found conflicting evidence regarding the industry.

Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that the agency finding conflicting evidence regarding the industry implies that the industry clearly violated the standards, the agency made an inconclusive finding in the investigation.

Rule19: Provided that it is not the case that the agency finding conflicting evidence regarding the industry implies that the industry clearly violated the standards, it is not the case that the agency made an inconclusive finding in the investigation.

Rule20: If it is not the case that the industry achieving compliance with the Clean Air Act implies that the agency enforced the emission limits regulation, then the agency imposed a penalty on the industry.

Rule21: Under the condition that it is not the case that the industry achieving compliance with the Clean Air Act implies that the agency enforced the emission limits regulation, the industry committed a violation of the emission standards.

Rule22: Provided that it is not the case that the industry achieving compliance with the Clean Air Act implies that the agency enforced the emission limits regulation, the agency launched an investigation into the industry.
Rule23: Provided that the governor did not issue an emergency directive to the industry, the industry achieved compliance with the Clean Air Act.
facts: Fact1: The commission held a public hearing on the regulation.
Fact2: The agency collected monitoring data as evidence.
Fact3: It is not the case that the agency passed the pollution control policy.
Fact4: The agency did not grant an exemption to the industry.
Fact5: It is not the case that the board conducted an independent review of the investigation.

question: The governor issued an emergency directive to the industry.
